performances.venue: Evans Field House, Northern Illinois University Dekalb, Il
performances.description: High energy opener  Very spirited and rocking right off the bat.  Start of a great night in Dekalb!

performances.venue: Field House - Seneca College Toronto, ON
performances.description: Swinging version
Lotsa fun rocker with the louche touch becoming of the song. Did Donna ever sound better than Summer '76?
This show is often overlooked, but excellent on its own merits.  Opens with a bang with a powerful Might As Well.
Upbeat and fun!

performances.venue: Deer Creek Music Center Noblesville, IN

performances.description: Jer's having a ball with strong vox he delivers the heat and a paint peeling solo to close the 1st set.

performances.venue: William and Mary College Hall Williamsburg, VA
performances.description: Set 2 opener on Dave's Picks 4. Tough to find Jerry solos much better than this.
At the Beacon Theatre in NYC, Jerry noodles his way out of the first set with this upbeat tune.

performances.venue: Madison Square Garden New York, NY
performances.description: Ends a great first set. Jerry is hot all night long
Like the one 2 days prior, this one packs a punch to start the show off right...gotta check it out!

performances.venue: Greek Theatre, U. Of California Berkeley, CA
performances.description: Everything sounds great with the exception of Jerry vocals, great instrumentals on this.
New C.Miller cleanup (10/17) brings in the love. Brilliant show opener with everything '76 has to offer: Hot mellow, lyricisms, and DJG at her best.
So smoking that Orlando refused to allow GD back to town.  Also, local press called it "Mighty Swell"
Just another great performance from this month.
This entire Palladium run is a Keith clinic.
1994? Really?!?!
Barnburning storm burster so strong it blows out speakers around 03:30 in. Kicks off the party with Jerry in full form, vox and guitar.

performances.venue: Community War Memorial Auditorium Rochester, NY
performances.description: DP 34- Jerry and Donna’s vocals are really great, whole band gets into it
The whole band firing on all cylinders once again this is a hot show full of deep bass and Donna restrained and in tune tight Jerry licks Wonderful MW
The main solo sounds like liquid sunshine, great stuff.
First time played, first song played after hiatus, absolutely NAILED. Check out the matrix version!
Jerrys vocals are just magic is this song a must hear version!!!!
THIS WHOLE SHOW IS A BEST OF!!!!!!!!!!

performances.venue: Carolina Coliseum - University of South Carolina Columbia, SC
performances.description: Jerry is amped to start, amped to play, amped to destroy this tune

performances.venue: Sam Boyd Silver Bowl Las Vegas, NV
performances.description: Listened to many listed here and through many of the best shows in my collection, and this one is my fav... Check it out!
Absolutely delcious with tasty contributions by all but particularly Keith Jerry and Donna Fantastic, Rip Roaring Jerry solo
Had to add this one from my personal favorite memories, after Jerry’s belting out, “Take that ride Again” just slams into his solo, many many highligh
From Cincinnati `76 & also apparently on of the rare times this rocker was used to close a set! Also the pick of the day for 11~9~23 Dead days
Jerry is feeling it......
This is the one

performances.venue: Downs of Santa Fe Santa Fe, NM
performances.description: High energy vocals and playing
How is this not listed?! I realize all the June 76 versions were great but this is mind-blowing!

performances.venue: Blossom Music Center Cuyahoga Falls, OH
performances.description: Might as well end this kickass set with a kickass rendition
Killer 2nd set Might As Well!!
Great party starter. This song always signals good time ahead.
Might As Well -> Samson & Delilah to open the second set.

performances.venue: St. Paul Civic Center St. Paul, MN
performances.description: God, I love this song.
love this one

performances.venue: Salt Palace Salt Lake City, UT
performances.description: First Might As Well since 2-17-1979 Salt Palace, Salt Lake City, Utah
Good times for all on this sweet set closer, coming out of a killer TMNS.
Raging and rare encore!

performances.venue: Silva Hall, Hult Center Eugene, OR
performances.description: Great first set closer with Jerry wailing
Real fun and bouncy. Definitely recommend!
Always great when this song comes up in the rotation -- and this one delivers
I…MIGHT AS WELL… put this here (kill me)
Like a racehorse charging out of the gate, winning it wire to wire. I'm diggin' '82 more and more.
finger-lickin' good Red Rocks show, Lazy lightning/supplication for a while straight into this barnstorming Might as well, fireworks!!!

performances.venue: Greek Theatre, U. Of California Berkeley, CA
performances.description: Nice light and bouncy version. Jerry is spot on with his lyrics. The boys sound like they're having fun.
Puppet master. Barrels out of a daze of a TMNS. "The elegant way"? that's for the drooling troglodytes of the public to decide, but whole lot of heart

performances.venue: Veterans' Memorial Coliseum New Haven, CT
performances.description: tight bucket yields this hoarse , ever so blue hot, blistering version!! Heavy late night express jerry soul rocker, big man sends it, gnarly version.

performances.venue: Community War Memorial Auditorium Rochester, NY
performances.description: u heard the big man.. mighty swell

performances.venue: Cumberland County Civic Center Portland, ME
performances.description: with feeling

performances.venue: Patrick Gymnasium, U of Vermont Burlington, VT
performances.description: Jerry saves a rough 1st set!
A tad abrupt on the ending but a fun one! They played a mighty swell one the night before so they probably figured 'might as well' play it again
Give this a spin, just like the song suggests.
Sweet bustout at Keith and Donna's last show. Jerry's solo is great.

performances.venue: Greek Theatre, U. Of California Berkeley, CA
performances.description: Killer Let it Grow>Might as Well to close the 1st set!
Whole lot of fun here.  Sounds like they meant it on this one.  Closes out a great first set.
